comments.html:
Some of you might enjoy this exchange of e-mails :) Here is the initial request.
==================
Dear all!

I own the 'ioshints.info' domain and would like the CNAME 'wiki.ioshints.info' to be served from my Linux account ******

However, I have two problems:

#1: Although I am supposed to have ** (free?) DNS aliases with the '******' service plan, the form on the control panel insists I will be billed $***/month for the DNS alias.

#2: the control panel also wants me to transfer the 'ioshints.info' domain to you, which is not what I need. I have already set up the CNAME on my end and all I need is the correct settings in the Apache server.

Could you help me, please, to get this set up?
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
The first response (22 hours later)
==========================
Thank you for your email. I can assure you that the current web hosting plan for ******** includes 10 domain name aliases. Continue with the sign up and you will not see any additional charges applied.

If you need any further ssistance, please do not hesitate to contact our 24/7 support team at ********.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
I'm soooo glad my hosting plan is what I've expected from the marketing info. Now let's try to get into the technical details ...
===========================
Thanks for answering the "business" part of my question. Let's return to the technical part. Allow me to reiterate it, please:
===================================
I own the 'ioshints.info' domain and would like the CNAME 'wiki.ioshints.info' to be served from my Linux account ********.

The "control panel" (the "add domain alias" function") wants me to transfer the 'ioshints.info' domain to you, which is not what I need. I have already set up the CNAME on my end and all I need is the correct settings in the Apache server.
===================================
Could you help me, please, to get this set up?

Thanks in advance & best regards
Ivan
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: To cut the long story short ... finally someone who understood what I'm trying to get stepped in and explained that they cannot do it. Time to look for an alternative ...
